description: {"blocks":[{"key":"148o1","text":"Imaging of plants can be done in an inexpensive way, using Raspberry Pi based setup. Here - we describe how we are processing the side-view images taken from 7 different sides - using the PlantCV pipeline. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

groups.title: Stress Architecture and RNA Biology Lab BTI

status.info: We use this protocol and itâ€™s working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"2s13b","text":"Download the data from RaspberryPi computer, where the images are being saved into one folder. If you have multiple stands for side-view image collection - download all the images into one folder entitled as your experiment. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9bhuh","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a3k4f","text":"NOTE - please make sure that the RapberryPi's were recording the timestamp correctly (i.e. were continuously connected to the internet router - that ensures the right time and date being timestamped on each image).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1q9nh","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5tpsr","text":"If your RaspberryPi computer was not connected to the internet throughout the experiment - it is better to save each day of imaging in a separate folder. It will be slightly more work to analyze them but will ensure that your timestamp is correct.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"78ahu","text":"On your desktop/laptop - make sure to have Conda, Jupyter Notebook and PlantCV installed, including all the dependencies. {"blocks":[{"key":"5c122","text":"After you have run throughout the jupyter notebook - please make sure that:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fvl0d","text":"1) the MASK is covering all of the plant parts (chunk #11) - i.e. all of your plant bits are covered with the PINK mask","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"34q91","text":"        IF that is not the case - please adjust the threshold values in v_thresh and a_thresh channels ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8ehgf","text":"        (chunks #6 and #8 respectively)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e5cun","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1g76d","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"evdsq","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9k7th","text":"2) if the ROI (Region of Interest) is at least partially covering your plant (chunk #12)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"aimi0","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bdlp4","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"14u7n","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fnv05","text":"3) if there are any other elements of the picture included in the final measurement - in the last chunk. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4u81h","text":"        It is possible that some stems are going to be too thin to be recognized by the PlantCV. For our purpose - estimating the biomass from 7 different side-angles - as the major plant parts are included in the measurements - we should be good to go. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ehkd3","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3hvlf","text":" {"blocks":[{"key":"6b356","text":"Re-run the pipeline on afew example images from your dataset - including young and old plants - and plants that differ in their coloring (e.g. lime green vs. dark green) - by selecting different images in chunk #3.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ce2ru","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3tjs5","text":"Please note that you can also use a file name as \"my_picture\" to select the files that you want to use for testing:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8n943","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"euej1","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"8lac","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"1D02A150A15011ECB1E98BD2F82479B5","height":106,"id":218663,"is_video":false,"legend":"","mime":"image/png","nestedSelector":null,"original_name":"Screen Shot 2022-03-11 at 10.29.44 AM.png","placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/gxtjg3kw.jpg","shadow":false,"source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/gxthg3kw.jpg","webp_placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/gxtig3kw.webp","webp_source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/gxtgg3kw.webp","width":550}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1ageb","text":"For processing the images - we need to prepare a json file that will contain the information on:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4ffr7","text":"- the path to the repository containing ALL of your images - indicated as \"input_dir\" in the 2nd line of the json file","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":74,"length":11}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cfmt4","text":"- the path to the json output file - indicated as \"json\" in the 3rd line of the json file","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":50,"length":6}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fnc0p","text":"- the way that your images are named - the order of timestamp - plant barcode - id - camera - indicated as \"filename_metadata\" in 4th line of the json file","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":107,"length":19}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"62m36","text":"- the path to the python code to be used - indicated as \"workflow\" in the 5th line of the json file","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":56,"length":10}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"74a23","text":"- the path to the repository where all the PROCESSED results will be deposited - indicated as \"img_outdir\" in the 6th","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cs33f","text":"- delimiter between the individual elements of the file name - we usually use underscore - indicated as \"delimiter\" in the 11th line of the json file","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":104,"length":11}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9h3lq","text":"- the timestamp format - indicating the general organization of your time-metadata in the file name - indicated as \"timestampformat\" in line 13 of the json file","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":115,"length":17}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7gmm1","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4l7f6","text":"NOTE: Please adjust json file ONLY in the code-processing software - such as Atom. Otherwise, you are running a risk that the individual symbols are going to be changed by your text editing software - and damage the json file.  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":77,"length":4}],"data":{}},{"key":"ef7hj","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f0ev5","text":"NOTE: the output directories should exist PRIOR to going on with the next steps. Please make sure to generate the correct folders. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6ba6d","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c3dje","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"2a126","text":"The example json file is attached below","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4mcs7","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4785r","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"F9742A20A15311ECB1E98BD2F82479B5","url":"https://atom.io/"}},"1":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"E15CDE00A15311ECB1E98BD2F82479B5","height":280,"id":218667,"is_video":false,"legend":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"48kdn","text":"The part of the json file that needs to be adjusted to individual experiments","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}},"mime":"image/png","nestedSelector":null,"original_name":"Screen Shot 2022-03-11 at 10.56.39 AM.png","placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/gxtpg3kw.jpg","shadow":false,"source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/gxtmg3kw.jpg","webp_placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/gxtng3kw.webp","webp_source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/gxtkg3kw.webp","width":550}},"2":{"type":"file","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"forceSelection":true,"guid":"195D5850A15611ECB1E98BD2F82479B5","id":217038,"original_name":"2022.03.07_tepary.json","placeholder":"","raw_source":"","source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/pr-journal/files/gv8qg3kw.json"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fn0fl","text":"PROBLEMS with file naming? - Check out our SOLUTION here. NOTE - this step is OPTIONAL - and only applicable if you have oddly-named files:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"38vm7","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4rsmp","text":"Recently - we were recording the images with the error in their names - i.e. the timestamp was separated by a \".\" but the Raspberry Pi was also separated by a \".\", instead of an \"_\". If something similar happens to you - that you have to rename your files prior to batch processing - follow this step:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e0dv6","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"at7pt","text":"1) determine the UNIQUE part of your name that you would like to change - such as \".Raspi\" - rather than just \".\" or \"_\" - ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"36trf","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fvirt","text":"In our case - we had to rename \".RaspiY\" to \"_RaspiY\" for correct delimiter between \"timestamp\" and \"plantbarcode\" - like on the screenshot below:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bhob8","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"u8gv","text":"   ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"fuoq3","text":"2) in the terminal - navigate to your directory containing the wrongly named images - and run the following command line - which will take ALL images containing in their name \"RaspiY\", and replace a specific part of the file name indicated in the \"sed\" part of the command. This code will generate a file called \"rename.txt\" that will be saved in the same folder as your original images.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fbcbc","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"h9au","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"5gcgo","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bhfe4","text":"3) open the rename file which should contain ALL the \"move\" commands (mv) for all the files within your directory with your wrongly named images. Should look something like the screenshot below:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b1jne","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dibu6","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"ad4pd","text":"4) copy ALL the contents of the rename.txt file - and paste them into your terminal window. This will run ALL the rename commands - that will replace the plant name in your repository with the wrongly made images. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6rlfq","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6vabc","text":"5) check the repository if the names are indeed changed to the correct names.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dsnbj","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"p6jf","text":"   ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":3,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"7qaft","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"EF45B310A15411ECB1E98BD2F82479B5","height":400,"id":218671,"is_video":false,"legend":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"2rpip","text":"wrongly named images","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}},"mime":"image/png","nestedSelector":null,"original_name":"Screen Shot 2022-03-11 at 11.04.13 AM.png","placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/gxttg3kw.jpg","shadow":false,"source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/gxtrg3kw.jpg","webp_placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/gxtsg3kw.webp","webp_source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/gxtqg3kw.webp","width":550}},"1":{"type":"code_insert","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"3u291","text":"ls -1 *RaspiY* | awk '{print(\"mv \"$1 \" \" $1)}' | sed 's/.RaspiY/_RaspiY/2' \u003e rename.txt","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}},"2":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"BA9769A0A15511ECB1E98BD2F82479B5","height":210,"id":218675,"is_video":false,"legend":"","mime":"image/png","nestedSelector":null,"original_name":"Screen Shot 2022-03-11 at 11.08.51 AM.png","placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/gxtxg3kw.jpg","shadow":false,"source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/gxtvg3kw.jpg","webp_placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/gxtwg3kw.webp","webp_source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/gxtug3kw.webp","width":550}},"3":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"815A4940A15611ECB1E98BD2F82479B5","height":339,"id":218679,"is_video":false,"legend":"","mime":"image/png","nestedSelector":null,"original_name":"Screen Shot 2022-03-11 at 11.15.28 AM.png","placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/gxt3g3kw.jpg","shadow":false,"source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/gxtzg3kw.jpg","webp_placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/gxt2g3kw.webp","webp_source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/gxtyg3kw.webp","width":396}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"di3oi","text":"Now - you have prepared ALL the files - make sure to also have plantcv-workflow.py and plantcv-utils.py codes in your directory - it does NOT have to be the same directory as your experiment/images. Just have them somewhere with the identifiable path to them","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"eaoek","text":"    ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":2,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"file","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"forceSelection":true,"guid":"39DB9000A15711ECB1E98BD2F82479B5","id":217043,"original_name":"plantcv-utils.py","placeholder":"","raw_source":"","source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/pr-journal/files/gv8vg3kw.py"}},"1":{"type":"file","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"3E3DFFC0A15711ECB1E98BD2F82479B5","height":0,"id":217044,"is_video":false,"legend":"","mime":"text/x-python-script","original_name":"plantcv-workflow.py","placeholder":"https://www.protocols.io/img/extensions/py.png","raw_source":"","source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/gv8wg3kw.py","type":5,"width":0}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"e27gi","text":"Run the following command - adjusting the path to your \"plantcv-workflow.py\" file and path to your \"json\" file prepared in step 11 of THIS protocol. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":55,"length":21}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5ca0i","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dgj7n","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"cudmv","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7h92c","text":"NOTE: if you are running it on your Desktop - this step might take some time (it took me +/- 20 minutes to process 980 images of cowpea) ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"code_insert","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"3bk6","text":"python /Users/magda/Documents/PlantCV/plantcv-workflow.py --config /Users/magda/Documents/PlantCV/2022.03.07_tepary.json","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9atbc","text":"Once the script is finished working - you should see the output files in the output directory specified in the json file generated in Step 11 of THIS protocol. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c69rl","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"97pj","text":"Please take time to go through the output files and make sure to go through the processed images - possibly identifying any problems that the python code had with identifying the plant parts in your images.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"tbo6","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1u7j9","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"app5","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"86773D20A15B11ECB1E98BD2F82479B5","height":575,"id":218683,"is_video":false,"legend":"","mime":"image/png","nestedSelector":null,"original_name":"Screen Shot 2022-03-11 at 11.46.58.png","placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/gxt7g3kw.jpg","shadow":false,"source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/gxt5g3kw.jpg","webp_placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/gxt6g3kw.webp","webp_source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/gxt4g3kw.webp","width":550}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"eg53t","text":"The script will also create a json file with the results in the output folder. It will look something like the screenshot below:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c0ncf","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ai0g8","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"40d58","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ejkmq","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e3m2j","text":"In our lab, we typically prefer to work with the .csv files rather than json files. To transform the json file into csv files - please run the below code adjusting the path to your \"plantcv-utils.py\" file and path to your  \"json\" file containing the results - produced by Step 15 of THIS protocol. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":181,"length":18}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e386v","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e0t1c","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"e923t","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d9djf","text":"The script will result in two files being produced:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9gr9e","text":"- Results-multi-value-traits.csv","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f5kk2","text":"- Results-single-value-traits.csv ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"202ot","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9uotu","text":"NOTE: if you are processing individual days separately - you might want to add a DATE identifier to these files before moving on with the next day processing - otherwise they will be renamed when you will run the next itteration of the code. If that happens - you can always re-run this step for the specific json file - as that will NOT be renamed - since the names are going to be unique (if you change them in the json file for each day in STEP 11!)  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"clq2h","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"95D0FCC0A15B11ECB1E98BD2F82479B5","height":368,"id":218687,"is_video":false,"legend":"","mime":"image/png","nestedSelector":null,"original_name":"Screen Shot 2022-03-11 at 11.47.34.png","placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/gxubg3kw.jpg","shadow":false,"source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/gxt9g3kw.jpg","webp_placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/gxuag3kw.webp","webp_source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/gxt8g3kw.webp","width":550}},"1":{"type":"code_insert","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"707pg","text":"python /Users/magda/Documents/PlantCV/plantcv-utils.py json2csv --json /Users/magda/Documents/PlantCV/Aparna/Results/2022.03.05.sample_image.json --csv /Users/magda/Documents/PlantCV/Aparna/Results","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4c5vp","text":"Processing the data further to calculate the cumulative plant area from all 7 angles as well as growth rates can be done in R. Please follow the example pipeline developed by Li'ang and Hayley in R, which can be accessed here.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":221,"length":4}],"data":{}},{"key":"1kh11","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7v9rr","text":"NOTE: it is a good practice to run a correlation analysis between your cumulative area and the fresh weight (if recorded) on the final day of the experiment.  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"BF25F5A0A15911ECB1E98BD2F82479B5","url":"https://rpubs.com/hs995/869470"}}}}
